multiple-choice.question: Let $n \geq 1$ be an integer and let $S_n$ be the number of ways in which $n$ can be written as a sum of 2's and 4's; the order in which the 2's and 4's occur in the sum matters. For example, $S_6 = 3$, because $$ 6 = 2 + 2 + 2 = 2 + 4 = 4 + 2. $$ Which of the following is true for any integer $n \geq 6$?
